name: Jupedsim
tagline: Simulating pedestrians with state of the art models.
body:
### JuPedSim
------------
Simulating pedestrians with state of the art models.
The JÃ¼lich Pedestrian Simulator ([JuPedSim](http://www.jupedsim.org)) consists of three modules which are loosely
coupled and can be used independently at the moment. These are:

1. `JPScore`: the core module computing the trajectories. [site of project](http://jupedsim.github.io/jpscore/).
2. `JPSvis`: a tool for visualising the input (geometry) and output (trajectories) data (not maintained).
3. `JPSreport`: a tool for analysing the trajectories. [site of project](http://jupedsim.github.io/jpsreport/).
4.  `JPSeditor`: a tool for creating and editing geometry files. 

The code is *actively developed* in a [GitLab repository](https://cst.version.fz-juelich.de/public/projects). Please consider cloning the code there.  

In order to communicate with the developers and/or to stayed  informed about the changes in the code, join our [slack team](https://jupedsim.slack.com) 

### Releases 

- You can download the latest [releases](https://github.com/JuPedSim/JuPedSim/releases)
- or pull our [docker images](https://hub.docker.com/u/jupedsim/)

### Showcase and tutorials

To highlight some features of `JuPedSim` we have uploaded  some videos on
our [YouTube channel](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCKS8w8CUClHEeN4K1SUSMBA).

### Contact 
- Mail: `info at jupedsim.org`
- Follow us [twitter](https://twitter.com/JuPedSim)
